User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:8.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0.1
Build ID: 20111120135848

Steps to reproduce:

I added the event listener for the click event (and other mouse events) to an element which has the CSS property "visibility: hidden".  Then I clicked the hidden element.  I attached a HTML file for the test.  


Actual results:

Click event (also other mouse events; e.g. mousemove event when the mouse pointer was moved on the element) didn't be fired.  


Expected results:

I think the click event should be fired when the hidden element is clicked, because DOM 3 Event specification (though this is still working draft) say that: 

"visibility of the element does not necessarily affect its ability to be the topmost event target, since an element which is hidden by use of the CSS 'visibility' property can still receive pointer events (though not one with a 'display' property of none)"
[ http://www.w3.org/TR/2011/WD-DOM-Level-3-Events-20110531/#glossary-topmost-event-target ]
